meanings.definition: (adjective) Of or relating to a person or animal raised on a diet primarily consisting of corn.
meanings.sent1: The cornfed cow happily grazed in the field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer preferred cornfed chickens for their meat.
meanings.sent3: The cornfed pig oinked with delight at the sight of fresh corn.
meanings.sent4: The cornfed rabbit hopped around the barnyard, full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The cornfed horse stood proudly in the pasture, showing off its healthy physique.

meanings.sent1: The farmer cornfed his livestock every morning.
meanings.sent2: She decided to cornfeed the chickens for a week to see if they liked it.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to cornfeed their toy animals in the make-believe farm.
meanings.sent4: The gardener cornfed the soil to ensure healthy plant growth.
meanings.sent5: He carefully cornfed the ducks by the pond, making sure they were well-fed.

meanings.definition: (noun) A person or animal that has been raised on a diet primarily consisting of corn.
meanings.sent1: The cornfed was the star attraction at the county fair.
meanings.sent2: The farmer proudly showed off his cornfed pigs at the market.
meanings.sent3: The cornfed in the barn seemed to have a special love for corn on the cob.
meanings.sent4: The cornfed in the pasture had a healthy glow to its fur.
meanings.sent5: The cornfed in the petting zoo was a favorite among children for its friendly nature.
